results.title: Between cultures
results.creator_credit: David Zweck, Daryl Wayland and Country Education Project
results.brief_description: Peter Couchman explores human relationships between cultures and the struggle to obtain cultural identity. The theme is gradually unfolded through interviews with Morag Loh, co-author of “The Immigrants” and discussion with people personally involved with the struggle between cultures.

results.title: Betty Pounder
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dance: Videos of Australian dancers and choreographers”.
As a dancer, ballet mistress, choreographer and director, Betty Pounder’s name is synonymous with musical theatre in Australia. She recalls the diverse and vital theatre scene in the heyday of “J.C. Williamson’s” and gives an insight into the working lives of musical performers. Pounder was responsible for presenting the work of America’s greatest choreographers and was associated with the Australian productions of landmark musicals such as “The Pyjama Game”, “Man of La Mancha”, “Camelot” and “My Fair Lady”. Pounder discusses the impact of developments in technique and training on dance in Australia and comments on current trends in musical theatre. Research and interview by James Murdoch.

results.title: Better work methods. Pt. 2: Brushing burrs from studs
results.brief_description: Illustrates original and then improved methods for (1) brushing burrs from studs; (2) assembling rope clips; (3) fundamental hand motions used in signing a letter; (4) pin board study; (5) bolt and washer assembly.

results.title: Better ways. Part 1. Introducing work study
results.creator_credit: Clifford Parris, James Carr, British Productivity Council and World Wide
results.brief_description: A survey of work study showing how it arises in response to the need to improve methods of work and how its “questioning technique”, carried out in full cooperation with all concerned - workers and maanagement alike - enables it to develop the improvements needed.

results.title: Better safe than sorry
results.brief_description: This film depicts situations that children could encounter with strangers, as well as with known adults, that involve physical and sexual abuse and shows children how to deal with these potential situations. Stresses that children are in no way to blame for the deviant behaviour of adults and should not feel guilty about their involvemenmt in these situations. Presents three rules for children to follow: SAY NO, GET AWAY, TELL SOMEONE. Suitable for Mid Primary-Upper Secondary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Better reading
results.brief_description: Illustrates examples of poor reading habits and shows how these may be overcome by adopting corrective reading methods. The film illustrates the case of an intelligent high school student whose work suffers from his slow reading habits. The student attends a mobile reading clinic where he undertakes a course in reading improvement designed to improve his vocabulary, increase his understanding, and speed up his reading techniques.

results.title: Betrayed by a handprint
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: Society lady turned thief gets caught out when she leaves her hand print at the scene of the crime. Cast includes Florence Lawrence, Harry Solter, Linda arvidson, Kate Bruce, Gene Gauntier, George Gebhardt, Mack Sennett. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: Bethune
results.creator_credit: Donald Brittain, John Kemeny and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A documentary on the life of Dr Norman Bethune, who opened up Spain’s first blood bank during the Spanish Civil War, and went to China where he acted as doctor on the famous “long march”. Using graphic film clips, stills and interviews with colleagues Dr Bethune’s legendary career is presented.

results.title: Bert Newton's IMT [Live from HMAS Cerberus]
results.creator_credit: Bill Beams, Terry Gill and National Nine Network
results.brief_description: A record of the IMT live broadcast from HMAS Cerburus during Navy Week in 1970 which includes commercials. Bert Newton is joined by Lucky Star; Gaynor Bunning; Tim Evans; Johnny Walker; Alison Durban; Judy Scott; Bettina and Bryce; Miss Teen America and Patti McGrath. Commercials include: Yalumba Brandivino; Mastercut butchers; Victa mowers (Pete Smith); National vacuum cleaners; Yates lawn seeds; Remy Martin Brandy; Benson & Hedges cigarettes (Stuart Wagstaff); Capitol bread; SPC canned fruit; Ponds face cream; Ponds busy girl instant shampoo; State Savings Bank; Kraft ‘quick n easy’ dried peas (Bruce Mansfield); Cedel anti-perspirent; Monash cigarettes; Gold Medallion homes; Lipton tea bags.

results.title: Bernstein on Beethoven: a tribute
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Burton, Amberson Productions and CBS
results.brief_description: Leonard Bernstein traces the life of Beethoven and plays sections from the “Piano Concerto No.1 in C Major” in a musical celebration of Beethoven’s Bicentennary at the Vienna Festival of Music. Suitable for Upper Secondary level students.
